Class MapTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • MapTest

  • public class MapTest
extends java.lang.Object

    MapMain

    Purpose: To exhaustively validate the Map.java class methods.

    Note: This is a modified version of Prof. Vybihal's code

    Since:
    October 2018
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Joseph Vybihal, Aidan Wadin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MapTest() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void testConstructor()
      The expectation is that an array is created and no errors are thrown Test if array is NULL and if error thrown Test negative boundary and too large integer boundary
      void testSetTerrain()
      Assumes: testConstructor passed ! The expectation is that the value stored in the location in the map is actually there Will do a visual test in this case (to be different from the above)
      void testToString()
      Assumes: test set terrain passed The expectation is that the full array displays No special testing, expecting to see all water.
      void testValidSize()
      The expectation is that a valid size is greater than or equal to zero Assumes integer range, therefore testing -1, 0, and 1 is enough.
      void testValidTerrain()
      The expectation is that a valid terrain is only these characters: ~ G # Assume ASCII range of characters, therefore testing 34=" 35=# 36=$ 71=G 72=H 126=~ 127={DEL]

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        The expectation is that a valid size is greater than or equal to zero Assumes integer range, therefore testing -1, 0, and 1 is enough.

      • testValidTerrain

        public void testValidTerrain()
        The expectation is that a valid terrain is only these characters: ~ G # Assume ASCII range of characters, therefore testing 34=" 35=# 36=$ 71=G 72=H 126=~ 127={DEL]
